instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Works fine if I short the pads.
Tried new top case, keyboard, trackpad, cables. I get no response from the power button, yet all other keys work fine.

SMC_LID is High and Low when the lid is up and down.
Pin 3 on J5700 shows 3.42 but doesn't react when I press the button.

Similarly, U5010::7 doesn't react and is always 3.4

Initially I figured it was the keyboard since there is no response at all. 

Any suggestions on what to look at next?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Pin 3 is ground. There is no way it shows 3.42v. I'm going to disregard that as a typo.

This is likely going to be a broken trace. Check the resistance from the trackpad to U5010 along SMC ONOFF L.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Sorry, pin 11 & 12. Woops.

Checking resistance now.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: Resistance from J5700::11 to U5010::7 is 0.4Ohms.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: Only thing this can be is a corroded connector, otherwise the board is fine and it is a parts issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Everything looks really clean.
Jacks look good.

I can read the 3.4 all the way to the jack on the Trackpad.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: This is not rocket science. Pinout for the air keyboards is the same as all MacBooks. I think pin 5 is power button. Check if there is 3V on the connector and see if it powers on if you short that pin to GND.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 11811"]This is not rocket science. [/QUOTE]

Yeh, I realise this is layer 1, that's why it has me confused.

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 11811"]
Pinout for the air keyboards is the same as all MacBooks. I think pin 5 is power button. [/QUOTE]

Pin 11, I think.

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 11811"]
Check if there is 3V on the connector and see if it powers on if you short that pin to GND. [/QUOTE]

The pin has 3v on both the jack on the LB and TP.

If I short the pin on the jack, it boots. Press the power key, no boot.

Tried with a new keyboard...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: Measure the voltage with and without the button pressed.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Yeh, forgot to mention that.

There is no measurable change when I press the button. :/

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: And you are measuring on pin 5 of KBD connector? The KBD connector on the trackpad!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
KBD Connector on the Trackpad?

Pin 5 on KBD jack on the track pad reads 3v and doesn't go down on btn press.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Bad keyboard or trackpad then.
Well there is one very unlikely option. Measure resistance from pin 5 to 3V42 bus, should be about 10K.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
I'm getting about 70k from pin 5 to the power pad.

Just swapped out to a new Trackpad too. 


This thing is sending me loopy.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: Are you counting from the correct side pin 5? Pin 5 should have 1K resistance to the power on pads on the board and 11K to 3V42 rail. There is a 1K resistor in line with the power button on the trackpad.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Hopefully I had it wrong.

Do you mean the jack on the Trackpad that the keyboard goes into?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: I don't see how keyboard connector on the trackpad can be interpreted any other way. Also mentioning that all macbook keyboards have the exact same pinout and exact same 30 pin connector.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: Yeh, not sure either. But considering there was case for possible confusion, it seemed worthwhile confirming.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: So did you measure again on pin 5? 11K to 3V42 and voltage with and without power button pressed. Also resistance from pin 5 to the pads on the board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Been out the office today.
Will take another look when I get back in on Tuesday.

Thanks for following up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Pin 5 to power pad = 0.99k.
Pin 5 to 3v42 rail = 9.35k.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: Well then it must work of the keyboard/connector is ok. Manually short pin 5 to GND and see if it powers on.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Hi Dukefawks.

It turns on when I short the pins on the Jack... so I went and got a third keyboard from a guy across town and it turns on.

Seems the replacement keyboard had a faulty power button too. 8|

Thanks for your help, sorted.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: Make sure it has the 2010 layout, the F keys have a different layout on 2010 keyboards.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
After you said that, I looked at the keyboard closer and the R & E keys were swapped around!! Brand new and the keys were wrong!

Need to get this thing off my desk, it's cursed. :/

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message: F keys are correct? The 2010 models are without backlight and still have the eject key. Usually you get the newer layout with backlight keys and no eject key.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 Won't turn on from Keyboard.
threads.message:
Yeh, the function keys are correct.
I noticed that there was no backlight which lead me to notice the keyboard was different.
